text: The 1999 Tippeligaen was the 54th completed season of top division football in Norway. Each team played 26 games with 3 points given for wins and 1 for draws. Number thirteen and fourteen are relegated, number twelve had to play two qualification matches (home and away) against number three in the 1. divisjon (where number one and two were directly promoted) for the last spot. ==Teams and locations== :Note: Table lists in alphabetical order. {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" |- ! Team ! ! Location ! Strømsgodset was relegated to 1. divisjon. ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- |1 |align="left"| Rune Lange |align="left"|Tromsø |23 |- |2 |align="left"| Andreas Lund |align="left"|Molde |21 |- |3 |align="left"| Jostein Flo |align="left"|Strømsgodset |18 |- |4 |align="left"| Ríkharður Daðason |align="left"|Viking |17 |- |rowspan="2"|5 |align="left"| Heiðar Helguson |align="left"|Lillestrøm |16 |- |align="left"| Bengt Sæternes |align="left"|Bodø/Glimt |16 |- |7 |align="left"| Sigurd Rushfeldt |align="left"|Rosenborg |15 |} ===Attendances=== == References == Category:Eliteserien seasons Norway Norway 1
